intro: Paraboea pubiflora, commonly known as the hairy-flowered paraboea, is a climbing plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or white in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical rainforests. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens.
